description: Part single storey rear extension and conversion of ground floor shop into three bedroom flat with two rooflights and balcony on flat roof above; part two storey rear extension to existing first floor residential unit, front and rear roof extension, conversion of roofspace into one self-contained unit and front elevation balcony (a total of three residental units).
decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of its scale and proportions, overall design and appearance would be considered an excessive and obtrusive development that is detrimental to the character and appearance of the host building and result in overdevelopment of the site. As such, it is considered the proposed extension would be contrary to section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 1.1 (e) (h), 3.1 (b) and 3.8 of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing's Development Management Development Plan (2013) and the advice contained in the interim Supplementary Planning Document 4: 'Residential Extensions' (2004). | The proposed development, by reason of its relationship on the property boundary, overbearing nature and loss outlook and light for No. 3 and 7, would cause a detrimental impact on the living conditions of current and future occupiers of these neighbouring properties. As such, the proposal is contrary to sections 7 and 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1 and 7.6 of The London Plan 2015 policies 1.1 (e) (h), 3.1 (b) and 3.8 of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing's Development Management Development Plan (2013) and the advice contained in the interim Supplementary Planning Document 4: 'Residential Extensions' (2004).
